top_categories.workout_context: 7,300ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
73ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At mile 60 of 100, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
At Pony Xpress, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Pony Xpress. Train it until it feels boring.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Pony Xpress' demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
Pony Xpress' High desert gravel, Foothills forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 100 miles.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 100 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
7,300ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
100 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 7,300ft of climbing on Colorado high desert and foothills gravel does to your power file on race day.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 100 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Pony Xpress’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Pony Xpress with 7,300ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. High altitude (6000-8800 feet).
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Pony Xpress requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on colorado high desert and foothills gravel to build confidence. Expect: high desert gravel, foothills, mining country.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on VO2max, TT Threshold, and Durability to prepare you for 100 miles of colorado high desert and foothills gravel in Cokedale, Colorado.
